name: Curfew; children in public streets, prohibited when; penalty
text: §577-16  Curfew; children in public streets, prohibited when; penalty.  Any child under sixteen years of age, who, except in case of necessity, or except when permitted so to do in writing by a judge of the family court, goes or remains on any public street, highway, public place, or private place held open to the public after ten o'clock in the evening and before four o'clock in the morning, unaccompanied by either a parent or guardian, or an adult person duly authorized by a parent or guardian to accompany the child, is subject to adjudication under section 571-11(2). [L 1896, c 29, §1; am L 1907, c 34, §1; am L 1913, c 124, §1; am L 1915, c 44, §1; RL 1925, §3049; RL 1935, §4530; am L 1943, c 78, pt of §1; RL 1945, §12282; am L 1949, c 279, §1; RL 1955, §330-14; am imp L 1965, c 232, §1; HRS §577-16; am L 1975, c 77, §1(5); am L 1980, c 303, §6]
